item.description: @chumak_iryna @KiarKini @britinvan @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock If Russia successfully breaks into pieces, the Basques might be inspired. Perhaps the Scots. Perhaps the Kurds. Andalusians. Balochs. Hmong. Palestinians. Rohingya. Uyghurs. Zulu. There will be an _enormous_ amount of elite pressure (worldwide) to prevent that idea spreading.

@chumak_iryna @KiarKini @britinvan @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock The collapse of the USSR was rather orderly compared to what _could_ happen to the Russian Federation, though. If the Russian economy collapses before the government does, perhaps the chaos following the fall of Rome might be a better precedent?

@chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock Choosing unity under fire is a testament to the wisdom of your countrymen. [All humans are cousins to one another, of course; in future centuries, I sincerely hope the concept of ‚Äòthey‚Äô (‚Äòwar‚Äô, too) becomes an anachronism.] The world is with your people. –°–ª–∞–≤–∞ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—ñ!

@britinvan @chumak_iryna @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock ‚Ä¶ but perhaps in different combinations today, due to changed demographics (some forced) and better communication. Unanswered question for future historians: were smaller nations preferable to larger ones?
@FPdabo @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock All walls fall, eventually, despite the best efforts of the powerful. Even the most feared tyrants eventually die.

@chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock Putin has managed to keep Russia together so far; whoever comes next may not be able to manage such an ‚Äòempire‚Äô. Will that ‚Äòsiloviki‚Äô survive, and will they still get paid? If so, will someone pay their salary from their own pockets? Will the ‚Äòsiloviki‚Äô splinter or stay united?

@chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock I agree. Outside of large cities, though, what if they didn‚Äôt _have_ to fight? If there is no one to fight against? If your town is a minority in a political subdivision, and the government collapses, then your town is a majority in your town. Perhaps your town becomes Monaco?

@chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock Parts of the USA would probably be better off as part of Canada, others as part of Mexico. Nation-states are such a recent contrivance, in terms of the history of human civilization. Their existence (and longevity) a thousand years from now may just be an interesting footnote.

@chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock With no army, what (besides economic limitations) would prevent some of those displaced groups from returning to their ancestral lands? Perhaps the oligarchs, warlords, and other elites will all band together under a common banner, but it seems at least as likely they would not.

@chumak_iryna @britinvan @KiarKini @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock Agreed. Normally force is needed to overcome force, yes, but what realistic force of the state will be left after the current misadventures? https://t.co/jZulDklg1Y

@KiarKini @chumak_iryna @britinvan @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock The Russian ‚ÄòFederation‚Äô can fail, but the pieces could still prosper. (Agreed that a failed, but intact, Russia would be a disaster on many levels.) Self-determination is an essential human right. Central management from Moscow has failed _multiple_ times over the centuries.
@KiarKini @chumak_iryna @francis_scarr @KevinRothrock No honor among thieves, right?
